0P00000D7Z.L.short_name: Man GLG Japan CoreAlpha Fund Re
0P00000D7Z.L.long_name: Man GLG Japan CoreAlpha Fund Retail Accumulation Shares (Class A)
0P00000D7Z.L.summary: The investment objective of the Fund is to provide capital growth by outperforming (net of fees) each of (i) TOPIX Total Return Index and (ii) the Russell/Nomura Large Cap Value Total Return Index, both converted to sterling, in a rolling five year period.
0P00000D7Z.L.manager_bio:
Stephen Harker is Head of Japanese Equities and leads the Japan CoreAlpha team. He has a BA in Mathematics and Economics from the University of Warwick and an MA in Economics of Finance from the University of Sheffield. 
Stephen has over 40 years of industry experience, and has concentrated on the Japanese equity market since April 1984. After a decade managing the Prudential Japanese Trust, he joined TCW London International in 1994. TCW was acquired in 2001 by SociÃ©tÃ© GÃ©nÃ©rale Asset Management (SGAM); SGAM UK was acquired by GLG Partners LP in April 2009; and GLG was in turn acquired by Man Group plc in October 2010. 
In January 2006, Stephen and the Japan equity team created the Japan CoreAlpha strategy which has grown into an industry leading large cap Japanese equity product.

0P00000LLH.T.summary: The investment objective of the Comgest Growth Japan fund is to create a professionally managed portfolio consisting of what, in the opinion of the Investment Manager, are high quality long-term growth companies based or operating in Japan.
0P00000LLH.T.manager_bio: Chantana Ward joined Comgest in 1999 and is an Analyst and Portfolio Manager specialising in Japanese equities. Chantana co-leads portfolios within Comgestâs Asia ex Japan, Asia including Japan and Japanese equity strategies, and has been an important contributor to the development of these strategies. Based in Paris, she travels regularly to Japan to research companies and spend time with the Tokyo-based team members. Chantana holds an MSc in Finance from Baruch Collegeâs Zicklin School of Business in New York, a dual diploma with The American University of Paris.

0P00000QW8.L.long_name: Baillie Gifford Japanese Fund ClassA Acc
0P00000QW8.L.summary: The Fund aims to outperform (after deduction of costs) the TOPIX, as stated in Sterling, by at least 1.5% per annum over rolling five-year periods.The Fund will invest at least 90% in shares of Japanese companies being those which are listed, incorporated, domiciled or conducting a significant portion of their business in Japan. The fund will be actively managed and will invest in companies of any size and sector.
0P00000QW8.L.manager_bio: Matthew graduated BA (Hons) in Natural Sciences (Psychology) from the University of Cambridge in 2003 and holds a PhD in Psychology from Bristol University. He joined Baillie Gifford in 2003 and is an Investment Manager in the Japanese Equity Team. Matthew is a co-manager of the Japanese All cap strategy and is a CFA Charterholder.

0P000024RA.F.summary: Le FCP met en oeuvre une gestion active. Il a pour objectif sur un horizon dâinvestissement de 5 ans, la recherche dâune performance de long terme, Ã  travers une gestion discrÃ©tionnaire dans lâunivers des entreprises cotÃ©es sur le marchÃ© japonais. A cet objectif, est associÃ©e une dÃ©marche de nature extra-financiÃ¨re, Ã  travers une gestion ISR, intÃ©grant des critÃ¨res ESG (Environnement, Sociaux et de Gouvernance) de maniÃ¨re systÃ©matique et discriminante.

0P000024Y8.T.summary: The investment objective of this Fund is to provide long-term capital growth by identifying and acquiring undervalued Japanese equities by capitalizing on the Investment Advisor's intensive "inhouse" research expertise and extensive information network established through independent investment experience in Japan since 1989. The Fund seeks long-term capital appreciation.
0P000024Y8.T.manager_bio: Mr. Abe began his career as an analyst for Nomura Research Institute (Japan) and transferred to Nomura Securities in 1982. After working in Japanese equity institutional sales at Nomura Securities International (New York), he formed Abe Capital Research Inc. in 1985 and managed Japanese equity investments for US and European investors. In 1989, Mr. Abe returned to Tokyo, Japan to start SPARX Asset Management (SPARX). He founded SPARX USA in 1994 and has been a portfolio manager of the fund since its inception. Mr. Abe graduated from Sophia University with a B.A. in Economics in 1978 and obtained an MBA from Babson College. He completed Harvard Business School's Advanced Management Program (AMP) in 2005.

0P00006ANK.TW.summary: The fund mainly invests in securities in Japan, including Stocks (including consigned stocks), benefit certificate, fund shares, investment unit (including REATs), DR in Japan's stock exchange market or JASDAQ, or bonds issued by governments traded in Japan; as well as invests in the government bonds, corporate bonds, financial bonds in the Republic of China, and the authorised international financial organizations bonds, benefit securities or asset based securities in accordance with the Regulations of Financial Assets Securitization and REATs in accordance with the Regulation of the Real Estate Securitization.

0P00008E7S.L.summary:
The Fundâs investment objective is to achieve capital appreciation through participation in the growth of the Japanese economy. 
Investment will be based primarily on Japanâs economic strengths, such as its manufacturing industry (in particular on those parts of it that are demonstrating an ability to exploit newly emerging technology) and on sectors benefiting from structural change in the economy. Investment will be in directly held transferable securities. The Fund may also invest in collective investment schemes, warrants and money market instruments.
0P00008E7S.L.manager_bio:
Andrew Rose is a Fund Manager at Schroders, which involves managing the Schroder Tokyo Fund the Schroder Japan Growth Fund. He joined Schroders in 1981 and is based in London.

Andrew was Head of Japanese Equities at Schroders from 2001 to 2006, which involved managing the Japanese Equity desk.
He was a Senior Investment Officer - Japan at Schroders from 1996 to 1999, which involved managing Japanese fund decisions.

Qualifications: Postgraduate in International Economics from Kobe University, Japan; BA in Japanese & Politics from University of Sheffield.

0P0000K158.L.short_name: LF Ruffer Japanese Fund I Accum
0P0000K158.L.long_name: LF Ruffer Japanese Fund I Accumulation
0P0000K158.L.summary:
The investment objective of CF Ruffer Japanese Fund is to provide capital growth by investing in a portfolio of predominantly Japanese equities, though Japanese fixed income securities and fixed income securities and equities from other geographical areas may be utilised if the Investment Manager believes they will assist in meeting the overall objective of the sub-fund. 
The subfund may also invest in collective investment schemes, cash, money market instruments, other transferable securities and derivatives and forward transactions and other investments to the extent that each is permitted by the Regulations. There will be no particular emphasis on any industrial or economic sector.

0P0000M469.T.long_name: E.I. Sturdza Funds plc - Nippon Growth (UCITS) Fund M JPY
0P0000M469.T.summary: The investment objective of the Fund is to achieve long-term capital growth through active sector allocation and stock selection resulting from changes in economic conditions
0P0000M469.T.manager_bio:
Uda-san is the President and CIO of Evarich Asset Management, an investment advisory company founded in 2002, which is licensed by the Ministry of Finance in Japan. Uda-san has over 35 years experience in asset management and the Japanese stock market.

From 2000 -2002 Uda-san acted as Managing Director and CIO for Nikko Asset Management.
From 1985-2000 Uda-san was a fund manager of Japanese equities at Baring Asset Management where he was appointed a Director in charge of Far Eastern markets in 1988. At Barings, he was initially based in London for 7 years and after that in Tokyo for 8 years. 
From 1971-1985 Uda-san worked at Nikko Securities as an analyst after graduating from Tokyo University.
Uda-san was selected as one of the top 20 fund managers in Europe (all classes) for the year 2006 by Citywire.
Uda-san is the portfolio manager for the Nippon Growth Fund, the Nippon Growth (UCITS) Fund and the Strategic Evarich Japan Fund.

0P0000VFD3.L.long_name: Tokio Marine Japanese Equity Focus Fund F GBP Unhedged
0P0000VFD3.L.summary: The objective of the fund is to achieve long-term capital growth over the TOPIX Total Return Index by investing in a concentrated, high-conviction portfolio of stocks, focusing on companies' 3-5 year earnings growth.
0P0000VFD3.L.manager_bio: Hiroyasu Sato, Senior Fund Manager, joined Tokio Marine Asset Management as Senior Analyst in January 2011 and has been a key member of the Japanese equity management and investment research teams having been both a portfolio manager and a senior analyst.Hiroyasu started his career in 1998 as a Japanese equity research analyst at Daiwa Institute of Research Ltd., covering the Japanese electronics industry. Hold BSc and MSc in Nuclear Engineering from Kyoto University.

0P0000Z8RO.T.short_name: GAM Star Japan Leaders Class No
0P0000Z8RO.T.long_name: GAM Star Japan Leaders Class Non UK RFS JPY Accumulation
0P0000Z8RO.T.summary:
The investment objective of the Fund is to achieve long-term capital appreciation through investing primarily in quoted equity securities in Japan issued by companies with principal offices in Japan.
 It will be the policy of the Fund to invest primarily in equities. However, up to 15 per cent. of the Net Asset Value of the Fund may be invested on a short term basis in Fixed Income Securities and preferred stock, if the fund manager considers this course of action appropriate to the goal of maximising capital growth.
0P0000Z8RO.T.manager_bio: Ben Williams is a Senior Investment Manager in GAM's Pacific/Japan investment team. Prior to joining GAM in October 2002, Ben was a fund manager at Royal Sun Alliance Investments for six years, where he began his career. Ben holds a BA in Economics from Durham University and an MSc in Investment Analysis from Stirling University. He is based in London.

0P0000ZPWM.HK.summary: The PineBridge Japan Equity Fund seeks to provide capital appreciation through a managed portfolio of shares in Japanese companies.
0P0000ZPWM.HK.manager_bio: Mr. Saito joined PineBridge in April 2002 upon its merger with Chiyoda Life Capital Management Co., Ltd. (CLCM). He is a Portfolio Manager for Japan Equity Strategy. Prior to joining CLCM, Mr. Saito was a Japanese Equities fund manager at Chiyoda Mutual Life Insurance. His industry experience dates back to 1991. Mr. Saito received a BA from Gakushuin University. He is a Chartered Member of the Security Analysts Association of Japan.

0P0001CNSY.L.summary: The aim of the Fund is to provide a return on your investment (generated through an increase to the value of the assets held by the Fund and/or income received from those assets) by tracking closely the performance of the FTSE Japan Index (âIndexâ). 0P0001H4OU.L.summary: The Fund aims to outperform (after deduction of costs) the TOPIX, as stated in Sterling, by at least 1.5% per annum over rolling five-year periods.The Fund will invest at least 90% in shares of Japanese companies being those which are listed, incorporated, domiciled or conducting a significant portion of their business in Japan. The fund will be actively managed and will invest in companies of any size and sector.
0P0001H4OU.L.manager_bio: Matthew graduated BA (Hons) in Natural Sciences (Psychology) from the University of Cambridge in 2003 and holds a PhD in Psychology from Bristol University. He joined Baillie Gifford in 2003 and is an Investment Manager in the Japanese Equity Team. Matthew is a co-manager of the Japanese All cap strategy and is a CFA Charterholder.
